it's bobbing up and down in that range

haven't they realized at this time that

there has been no improvement whatsoever
yes they've been manipulating a lot of

they're selling their airports the

austerities being implemented on the

whatsoever out in the UK we can see no

if we want the brexit more than 70

still believe the government should push
ahead with the brexit they don't care
they want it done and we can see that
the first round of talks is going to
happen
June 19th and think about all the things

they knew the talks were coming up
they're trying to derail this any way

last month and it just came down about

this is in the beginning of like say the

now Nike they are cutting around 2% of

stores are closing left and right
corporations are laying off people are
looking for work they can't find work
because what we're realizing right now

because they realized okay the economy

manufacturing output it dropped by 0.4

now we did have this little bounce when
Trump was elected but it seems like
everything is starting to fall apart now
and if we really look at this the Dow

it is down two percent from its peak in

and they're going in opposite directions
now so you can tell something is being

it is called the stock market now since
we're in this great recovery and the

inflation is holding and everything

raising the interest rates why is
Illinois why are they in tough shape
actually
Illinois's economic growth is worse than

state economic activity has increased

there were ten years ago millions of

is people are leaving and Illinois
now loses on that one person every four

this tells us that nothing's really

the economy's doing well the stock

according to Bloomberg's mark could more
he said the Fed has just brought the

we're already in a recession what he

every time they raised the rates like

now we were discussing in other reports

countries are starting to realize that

what's happening right now is this

at this point has lost about five

declining energy demand is a sure sign
